Detailed Description

Camera library header.

Author
Philippe Rétornaz

Macro Definition Documentation

#define ARRAY_HEIGHT   480
#define ARRAY_WIDTH   640
#define GREY_SCALE_MODE   0
#define POXXXX_FULL   1

If you set this at 0, you save about 168 bytes of memory But you loose all advanced camera functions

#define RGB_565_MODE   1
#define YUV_MODE   2

Function Documentation

int e_poxxxx_apply_timer_config ( int  pixel_row,
int  pixel_col,
int  bpp,
int  pbp,
int  bbl 
)

Modify the interrupt configuration

Warning
This is an internal function, use e_poxxxx_config_cam
Parameters
pixel_rowThe number of row to take
pixel_colThe number of pixel to take each pixel_row
bppThe number of byte per pixel
pbpThe number of pixel to ignore between each pixel
bblThe number of row to ignore between each line
Returns
Zero if OK, non-zero if the mode exceed internal data representation
See also
e_poxxxx_config_cam

unsigned int  sensor_width,
unsigned int  sensor_height,

unsigned int  zoom_fact_height,

)
int e_poxxxx_get_orientation ( void  )

Return the camera orientation

Returns
0: vertical 480x640, 1: horizontal 640x480, horizontal inverted, -1: unknown
int e_poxxxx_init_cam ( void  )

Initalize the camera, return the version in hexa, 0x3030 or 0x6030

int e_poxxxx_is_img_ready ( void  )

Check if the current capture is finished

Returns
Zero if the current capture is in progress, non-zero if the capture is done.
See also
e_poxxxx_launch_capture

Launch a capture in the buf buffer

Parameters
bufThe buffer to write to
See also

void e_poxxxx_set_awb_ae ( int  awb,
int  ae 
)

Enable/Disable AWB and AE

Parameters
awb1 means AWB enabled, 0 means disabled
ae1 means AE enabled, 0 means disabled
void e_poxxxx_set_exposure ( unsigned long  exp)

Set exposure time

Parameters
tExposure time, LSB is in 1/64 line time
Warning
Only meaningful if AE is disabled

Parameters
